line_1: Bless'd those which fell! curs'd those which still survive,
line_2: To mourn fifteen renew'd in forty-five.

line_1: But my affection will your scorn survive!
line_2: My fondness I, or you your power derive; —

line_1: Or future Dolours of the Birth survive.
line_2: Nor long, when once enjoy'd, the Females live,

line_1: His tuneless numbers hardly now survive,
line_2: And all his blithsome tales their praise derive

line_1: The Bard may die, the Thresher still survive.
line_2: THUS shall Tradition keep my Fame alive;

line_1: Granted, it shall no more survive;
line_2: Can faithful William yet forgive

line_1: And is he blasted? — then do I survive?
line_2: He was my Soul's best Pleasure while alive,

line_1: With pity I'll behold those that survive.
line_2: And when to those blest Mansions I arrive,

line_1: With rapture views, fair Freedom still survive
line_2: In you bright domes (ill-fated fugitive)

line_1: Why was I born, or why do I survive,
line_2: To be made wretched only, kept alive?

line_1: Fate-cut my Thread, I'll not the loss survive.
line_2: The best the brav'st, and faithful Friend alive;

line_1: Man shall alone the wreck of worlds survive,
line_2: Midst falling spheres immortal man shall live!

line_1: If yet this forer trial you survive,
line_2: Your Lordship is the patient'st man alive.

line_1: Nor let one darling Lust survive.
line_2: No more, but CHRIST in me may live!

line_1: Let this inscription on my tomb survive,
line_2: And if some friend, when I'm no more, should strive

line_1: This Piece a Son of Spain could scarce survive;
line_2: The Canvas speaks, 'tis Oliver alive.

line_1: The Dam destroy'd, the Imps not long survive;
line_2: By foreign Wars intestine Factions thrive,

line_1: And Love of Ombre, after Death survive.
line_2: Her Joy in gilded Chariots, when alive,

line_1: Not scornful Virgins who their Charms survive,
line_2: Not youthful Kings in Battel seiz'd alive,

line_1: Rather than so, ah let me still survive,
line_2: And burn in Cupid's Flames, — but burn alive.

line_1: Thy sacred grott shall with thy name survive.
line_2: On Thames's bank the stranger shall arrive,

line_1: Not for itself, alone, it can survive;
line_2: Supporting and supported it would live;
